snippet: The chief of Afghanistan’s intelligence service, Asadullah Khalid, survived an attack by a suicide bomber in Kabul on Thursday, Afghan officials said.
abstract: Taliban suicide bomber tries to assassinate Asadullah Khalid, head of Afghanistan's intelligence service and one of insurgency's fiercest opponents, leaving him seriously wounded; attack underscores insurgency's abilities to go after those at highest levels of government.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG, SANGAR RAHIMI and ALISSA J. RUBIN

lead_paragraph: The chief of Afghanistan’s intelligence service, Asadullah Khalid, survived an attack by a suicide bomber in Kabul on Thursday, Afghan officials said.

headline.seo: Afghan Spy Chief Hurt in Attack, Officials Say
headline.main: Afghan Spy Chief Is Wounded in Attack, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Afghan Spy Chief Is Hurt in Assassination Attempt, Officials Say
